author: FOX 8 Staff
title: Saints RB Alvin Kamara‚Äôs groin injury could be season-ending, ESPN reports
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - New Orleans Saints star running back Alvin Kamara may miss the remainder of the season as he deals with a groin injury.
Interim head coach Darren Rizzi says the injury to Kamara‚Äôs adductor, initially thought to be minor, is more significant than he thought. He said it does not look great for Monday night‚Äôs game against the Green Bay Packers.
According to a report by ESPN‚Äôs Adam Schefter, the injury could sideline Kamara for the rest of the season.
‚ÄúSaints RB Alvin Kamara‚Äôs groin injury still is being evaluated but it‚Äôs possible it is a season-ending injury and he has played his last down this year, per sources,‚Äù Schefter tweeted Thursday afternoon.
Saints RB Alvin Kamara‚Äôs groin injury still is being evaluated but it‚Äôs possible it is a season-ending injury and he has played his last down this year, per sources. pic.twitter.com/QYuFpl72VS
‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) December 19, 2024 Kamara exited last Sunday‚Äôs game against the Washington Commanders late in the contest.
The 29-year-old running back, who recently extended his contract with the Saints, has been a cornerstone of the team‚Äôs offense. His absence could open the door for younger talent, including rookie RB Kendre Miller, to step up during the final stretch of the season.
Kamara‚Äôs potential loss adds to a growing list of injuries impacting the Saints‚Äô lineup as they fight to secure a playoff spot.

author: Youssef Amenzou
title: Microsoft annonce des licenciements massifs dans l‚Äôindustrie du jeu vid√©o
text:
Microsoft a d√©but√© l‚Äôann√©e 2024 en annon√ßant des licenciements massifs dans l‚Äôindustrie du jeu vid√©o. La restructuration, qui touche Xbox, Bethesda et surtout Activision Blizzard, survient √† peine trois mois apr√®s l‚Äôacquisition de ce dernier pour pr√®s de 70 milliards de dollars. Les cons√©quences de cette d√©cision sont dramatiques, avec 1 900 employ√©s du secteur du jeu vid√©o qui perdront leur emploi.
Selon un communiqu√© de Phil Spencer, adress√© aux employ√©s, ces licenciements repr√©sentent 8 % du personnel jeu vid√©o de Microsoft, qui avait atteint le nombre impressionnant de 22 000 personnes avec l‚Äôajout de Bethesda et Activision Blizzard. Cette r√©duction d‚Äôeffectif vise √† √©liminer les doublons r√©sultant de l‚Äôacquisition, et bien que certaines suppressions d‚Äôemplois toucheront Xbox et Bethesda, c‚Äôest Activision Blizzard qui en subit le plus lourdement les cons√©quences.
L‚Äôacquisition d‚ÄôActivision Blizzard par Microsoft, bien que colossal en termes financiers, a entra√Æn√© des complications internes, g√©n√©rant des co√ªts que la soci√©t√© cherche d√©sormais √† r√©duire. La nouvelle est particuli√®rement difficile pour les employ√©s concern√©s, d‚Äôautant plus qu‚ÄôActivision Blizzard, avant son int√©gration chez Microsoft, avait enregistr√© des b√©n√©fices records malgr√© des vagues de licenciements en 2019 et 2021.
√Ä ce jour, les employ√©s touch√©s ne savent toujours pas s‚Äôils font partie des 1 900 qui devront quitter l‚Äôentreprise. Avec ces nouveaux licenciements, le total des pertes d‚Äôemploi dans l‚Äôindustrie du jeu vid√©o pour l‚Äôann√©e 2024 s‚Äô√©l√®ve d√©j√† √† 5 900, faisant de janvier un mois sombre pour le secteur.
Dans un communiqu√© interne, Phil Spencer a soulign√© que cette d√©cision √©tait douloureuse mais n√©cessaire pour aligner la strat√©gie de Microsoft Gaming et d‚ÄôActivision Blizzard sur une structure de co√ªts durable. Il a √©galement assur√© un soutien complet aux employ√©s touch√©s, y compris des indemnit√©s de d√©part conformes aux lois locales sur l‚Äôemploi.
Parall√®lement √† ces licenciements, des d√©parts notables ont √©t√© annonc√©s chez Blizzard, avec le pr√©sident Mike Ybarra quittant l‚Äôentreprise et Allen Adham, l‚Äôun des fondateurs, prenant √©galement ses distances. De plus, le projet de jeu de survie fantasy, Odyssey, est officiellement annul√©, avec certaines √©quipes redirig√©es vers de nouveaux projets en d√©veloppement chez Blizzard.
Cette annonce intervient apr√®s que Microsoft ait d√©j√† licenci√© 10 000 employ√©s en janvier 2023, bien que seule une partie d‚Äôentre eux concernait l‚Äô√©quipe jeu vid√©o. Les prochains r√©sultats financiers de l‚Äôentreprise, pr√©vus pour le 30 janvier, permettront de mesurer l‚Äôimpact d‚ÄôActivision Blizzard sur les chiffres de son activit√© jeu vid√©o. En juin 2023, Microsoft revendiquait 221 000 employ√©s dans le monde et a atteint une valorisation boursi√®re historique de 3 000 milliards de dollars.

author: Agencia Noticias Argentinas
title: Alerta meteorol√≥gica hoy por viento fuerte: ocho provincias afectadas
text: Alerta meteorol√≥gica hoy por viento fuerte: ocho provincias afectadas El Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional renov√≥ sus avisos para este viernes por viento fuerte en varias zonas del pa√≠s. El mal clima se mantiene este viernes en algunas zonas del centro y del sur del pa√≠s, para las que el Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional (SMN) renov√≥ sus alertas por viento fuerte. Se trata de un alerta amarillo para zonas de las provincias de San Luis, La Pampa, Mendoza, Neuqu√©n, R√≠o Negro, Chubut, Santa Cruz y Tierra del Fuego. En el sur de Chubut y todo Santa Cruz, el aviso sub√≠a a alerta naranja. Alerta amarillo y naranja por viento fuerte De acuerdo con el reporte del organismo, para zonas con alerta amarillo, ‚Äúel √°rea ser√° afectada por vientos del oeste, con velocidades entre 50 y 65 km/h, y r√°fagas que pueden superar los 100 km/h". En tanto, para regiones con aviso naranja, ‚Äúel √°rea ser√° afectada por vientos del sector oeste y sudoeste, con velocidades entre 65 y 85 km/h, y r√°fagas que pueden superar localmente los 120 km/h‚Äù. Recomendaciones del SMN por viento fuerte - Evit√° actividades al aire libre. - Asegur√° los elementos que puedan volarse. - Mantenete informado por autoridades. Ten√© siempre lista una mochila de emergencias con linterna, radio, documentos y tel√©fono.

author: Isabelle Barker
title: Max Verstappen escalates ban row with Red Bull as F1 champ says ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt tell them what to do in their private time‚Äô
text:
MAX VERSTAPPEN has told Red Bull to stay out of his personal life ‚Äî and vowed to carry on late-night gaming.
Formula One star
Verstappen also instructed his critics to ‚Äúturn the volume down‚Äù if they do not like his furious swearing on the team radio.
The Dutch driver, 26, came under fire for staying up until 3am on his ¬£10,000 racing simulator before the Hungarian Grand Prix.
On the real track the following day, he
crashed into Brit rival Lewis Hamilton late on and was effing and blinding on his team radio throughout ‚Äî before finishing in fifth place.
Red Bull adviser Helmut Marko said after the race the team had put a ban on Verstappen‚Äôs virtual racing.
But three-time world champ Verstappen insisted yesterday ahead of this weekend‚Äôs Belgian GP: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve talked about it. There are no new sim races coming up, so I said he doesn‚Äôt have to worry.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have a ban. I don‚Äôt tell them what to do in their private time at the weekend. That also applies to me the other way around.
‚ÄúSomething is always invented. If you don‚Äôt win a race, you get blamed for being up until 3am but in Imola I won the race, while I was also doing sim racing.
‚ÄúThis is not something new. I‚Äôve been doing this since 2015. So for me, this is not something that is any different in my preparation.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve won three world championships. I know what I can and what I cannot do.‚Äù
Most read in Motorsport
BEST FREE BET SIGN UP OFFERS FOR UK BOOKMAKERS
üèÅ Complete
F1 2024 race calendar - details on every Grand Prix and start time this year üèÅ
Verstappen extended his winless run to three races, his longest since 2021.
That stat may explain his fruity language last weekend as he blasted the team‚Äôs ‚Äús**t strategy, said his race was ‚Äúf****d‚Äù and also hit his steering wheel in qualifying.
And seven-time title-winner
Hamilton said Verstappen did not conduct himself like a world champ after the race.
The Mercedes ace stressed: ‚ÄúAs a team leader, as a team member, as a team-mate, you have to act like a world champion.‚Äù
He was asked if those comments from Verstappen portrayed that, to which Hamilton replied: ‚ÄúNot like it was last weekend.‚Äù
Verstappen said: ‚ÄúPeople that don‚Äôt like my language, then don‚Äôt listen in, turn the volume down.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm very driven to success, I‚Äôve proven that already, I always want to optimise stuff.
‚ÄúPeople can argue that he might not be so vocal on the radio but that‚Äôs their opinion.
‚ÄúMy opinion is that it needs to be said at the time, to maybe also try to force that the second pit stop would have been a bit different, that‚Äôs how it goes.‚Äù
Meanwhile,
Lando Norris has been feeling guilty team-mate Oscar Piastri‚Äôs maiden win in Hungary was overshadowed by his radio row.
Read More on The US Sun
The Brit, with one eye on the championship, ignored McLaren team orders to allow Piastri past on fresher tyres until just three laps to go.
He said: ‚ÄúThe fact I kind of clouded over Oscar‚Äôs first race win is something I‚Äôve not felt too proud about.‚Äù

author: Ben Blanchet
title: Stephen Colbert Has A Brutal Community Note For Mark Zuckerberg's Meta Changes
text:
Read full article HuffPost Stephen Colbert Has A Brutal Community Note For Mark Zuckerberg's Meta Changes Ben Blanchet January 10, 2025 at 8:47 a.m. ¬∑ 1 min read Link Copied
Stephen Colbert on Thursday mocked Mark Zuckerberg ‚Äôs changes to Meta after the tech billionaire announced that the company would trash its fact-checking program in favor of a ‚Äúcommunity notes‚Äù-like system for posts similar to that of X .
‚ÄúNo, do not trust the community, the worst part about social media is other people,‚Äù Colbert quipped.
The ‚Äú Late Show ‚Äù host noted that Zuckerberg is joining an intensifying race to ‚Äúkiss‚Äù President-elect‚Äôs Donald Trump ‚Äôs ‚Äúass‚Äù after he revealed that Meta companies ‚Äî like Instagram and Facebook ‚Äî would do away with a fact-checking program that he dubbed ‚Äútoo politically biased.‚Äù
Zuckerberg, who joins other Silicon Valley billionaires trying to apple-polish Trump ahead of his inauguration, met with the president-elect at Mar-a-Lago in November and also donated $1 million to his inauguration fund.
ADVERTISEMENT Prior to Trump‚Äôs recent election win, Trump reportedly accused Zuckerberg of having ‚Äústeered‚Äù Facebook against him in the 2020 election and threatened him with spending ‚Äúrest of his life in prison‚Äù were he to ‚Äúcheat‚Äù in the 2024 contest.
Colbert, on Thursday, highlighted how other people are the ‚Äúworst‚Äù part about social media platforms by turning to an ‚Äú actual Facebook post ‚Äù from NPR highlighting two giant pandas living it up in the snow at The National Zoo.
‚ÄúSo of course, somebody commented, ‚ÄòDaily reminder that the US is sending tax payer funds to the Taliban, weekly,‚Äô‚Äù the ‚ÄúLate Show‚Äù host noted.
‚ÄúThe pandas cannot help you with that, my man. They don‚Äôt even know how to have sex .‚Äù
Watch more of Colbert‚Äôs Thursday monologue below.
Related... 'Daily Show' Makes An 'Awkward' Analysis Of Trump's 'History' With Carter Funeral Guests

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' ‚ÄúIt is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,‚Äù wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson‚Äôs] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,‚Äù he said in his report. ‚ÄúTrying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.‚Äù Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. ‚ÄúAny negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem‚Äôs ‚Äúnegligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: Rich Kremer
title: Wisconsin Elections Commission rules second Vos recall effort has failed
text:
For the second time this year, the Wisconsin Elections Commission has ruled conservative activists failed to gather enough valid signatures to recall Republican Assembly Speaker Robin Vos from office, this time finding that some of the signatures were collected after the legal deadline.
In a 4-2 vote, the commission found that 188 signatures were collected by the Racine Recall Committee outside of a 60-day window in state law. That‚Äôs despite a recommendation by commission attorneys two days earlier saying recall organizers had collected enough signatures to force an election.
At issue were around 188 signatures collected on May 27, which was Memorial Day, and May 28. Because organizers gathered only 16 signatures more than required, subtracting 188 from that total sunk the petition.
The motion to deem the recall petition insufficient was made by Commissioner Don Millis, who was appointed to his seat by Vos in 2022 .
Before the vote, Commissioner Mark Thomsen, a Democratic appointee, urged his colleagues to vote against Millis‚Äô motion ‚Äúthat saves his guy,‚Äù insinuating that Millis was protecting Vos. Thomsen noted that some members of the recall effort ‚Äúprobably want to put us in prison‚Äù because of past decisions, but he said the Wisconsin Constitution gives them the right to recall officeholders.
‚ÄúPersonally, I think the recall is a waste of time, waste of money,‚Äù Thomsen said. ‚ÄúBut there is a constitutional right for these folks and for us to say we are going to throw the sufficiency out now on this technical rule is going to be a farce.‚Äù
Millis pushed back on Thomsen‚Äôs claims and said his motion was ‚Äúnot trying to save anyone‚Äôs hide‚Äù and voting to exclude signatures collected outside the 60 day period was the right thing to do.
‚ÄúThis is not the first time that we have disagreed with (commission) staff on recommendations,‚Äù Millis said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why we have a commission and not a staff making these decisions.‚Äù
A social media post from the Racine Recall Committee responding to the commission‚Äôs vote said the panel had ‚Äúthe elections commission of ‚Äúsilencing‚Äù ‚Äú silenced ‚Äù voters in Racine County.
They repeated claims of Vos protecting WEC Administrator Megan Wolfe, who the group and other conservatives have accused of bending election laws in 2020.
‚ÄúDespite collecting well over the required signatures, the commission, led by Wolfe, ignored their attorneys‚Äô recommendations to certify the recall petition,‚Äù the committee said. ‚ÄúNow, more than ever, we must vote out Robin Vos and demand the dismantling of the Wisconsin Elections Commission!‚Äù
While Wolfe leads staff at the WEC, she is not one of the six voting members of the commission.
A spokesperson for Vos did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
It could be difficult for Vos‚Äô conservative critics to vote out the powerful speaker with no recall election on the books. Vos represents an overwhelmingly Republican district, and his GOP challenger in the August primary already dropped out of the race.
